intro: Arkezostis setulosa, commonly known as the hairy sea fennel, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its finely hairy stems and leaves, which are often covered in fine, soft hairs. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It thrives in coastal environments and is often found in sandy or gravelly soils. Arkezostis setulosa is adapted to tolerate salt spray and is a common species in maritime regions.
